intro: Plectranthus sanguineus, commonly known as the red-veined begonia, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking, heart-shaped leaves with deep red veins against a dark green background. The plant produces small, pale purple flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in gardens.
